description: Number of squares between consecutive cubes.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,2000
example: a(2)= 3 as there are three squares 9,16 and 25 between 8 and 27. a(3)= 2 as there are two squares 36 and 49 between 27 and 64. ( 64 is not to be counted.)
mathematica: a[1] = 1; a[2] = 3; a[n_] := Floor[Sqrt[(n+1)^3-1]] - Floor[Sqrt[n^3+1]]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 04 2015, adapted from PARI *)
prog: (PARI) print1("1,3,"):for(n=3,100,print1(sqrtint((n+1)^3-1)-sqrtint(n^3+1)","))(PARI) { for (n=1, 2000, a=sqrtint((n+1)^3-1)-sqrtint(n^3+1); if (n==2, a=3); write("b061266.txt", n, " ", a); ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 20 2009]
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 24 2001
extensions: OFFSET changed from 0,2 to 1,2 by _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 20 2009
